Title: WATCH: PM Modi drives a car in Sweden from Delhi using 5G tech
Description:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on Saturday, remotely conducted a test drive 
of a car in Sweden in Europe from the Ericsson stall at the India Mobile 
Congress...
paragraph:
Modi was using the newly launched 5G technology to drive the car in another part of the planet.
PM @NarendraModi ji tests driving a car in Europe remotely from Delhi using India’s 5G technology.
Modi, at Reliance Jio's stall, was informed about the latest 5G technology by Mukesh Ambani and Akash Ambani.
Union telecom minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, at the event, said that this day will be recorded in golden letters.
Reliance Industries chairman Mukesh Ambani, who promised to deliver 5G to every town, every taluka by December 2023, said, "I can say we are ready to take leadership and Indian Mobile Congress should now become Asian Mobile Congress & Global Mobile Congress.

Title: How PM Narendra Modi drove a car in Sweden sitting in Delhi
Description:
sing a 5G-enabled solution, PM Modi took the controls of the car in Sweden 
by getting behind the steering wheel set up inside the Ericsson booth at 
the IMC...
paragraph:
Prime MinisterOne of the applications he tried out after inaugurating theWith the controls in Delhi connected to the model using 5G technology, Modi navigated an indoor course in Sweden.
Photos of PM Modi at the wheels were shared on social media soon after the inauguration of the event.
India driving the world.PM @NarendraModi ji tests driving a car in Europe remotely from Delhi using India’s 5G te… https://t.co/n0tYo00n9F — Piyush Goyal (@PiyushGoyal) 1664601864000While inaugurating the four-day India Mobile Congress (IMC) 2022, Modi visited several 5G pavilions and encouraged domestic startups to build 5G use cases.
At the Jio Pavilion, PM Modi looked at the 'True 5G' devices and spent time understanding the indigenous development of end-to-end 5G technology by a team of Jio engineers.

Title: Smartphone firms hail 5G launch, prepare bundled offers with telcos
Description:
New Delhi Oct 1 : Leading Smartphone Players On Saturday Said That The 5G 
Launch By Prime Minister Narendra Modi Will Unleash New Economic 
Opportunities And...
paragraph: The Indian Smartphone Users Are Even Willing To Pay A 45 Per Cent Premium For A Plan bundled With Novel Experiences, The Findings Showed, Which Could Be A Delight For Internet Service Providers Ready With 5G, According To The Ericsson Study.

Description:

Title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi Remotely Drives Car In Sweden From India At India Mobile Congress 2022
Description:
The Prime Minister of India got behind the controls of a remote-controlled 
vehicle at the Ericsson booth at the 2022 India Mobile Congress.
paragraph:
Saturday, October 1 marked the first day of the India Mobile Conference 2022 – one of Asia’s largest digital technology forums.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi was present on the inaugural day of the conference where he launched 5G services in India.
Modi also experienced some of the technologies displayed by brands at the event including driving a remote-controlled car, thousands of kilometres away from Delhi.
Set up at the Ericsson booth, the Indian Prime Minister got behind the wheel of an RC car sitting in Sweden.
The firm was using 5G technology to connect the controls in India to the model in Sweden.

Title: Ericsson wins Greenland 5G dealSEXI News
Description:
Local phone company Tussas said on Friday that Swedish telecommunications 
equipment maker Ericsson has been contracted to build a 5G network in 
Greenland,...
paragraph:
Local phone company Tussas said on Friday that Swedish telecommunications equipment maker Ericsson has been contracted to build a 5G network in Greenland, initially covering three cities.
RELATED: 5G is Coming: What Can We Expect?
Deploying Ericsson equipment and Netgear routers, Tusass will bring high-speed wireless Internet to the sparsely populated island without resorting to expensive and difficult-to-deploy cables, the company said.
Tussa said there are plans to invest about 1 billion Danish crowns ($131.3 million) to secure and expand Greenland’s infrastructure and improve communications.
Greenland, an island of only 56,000 people, is part of the Kingdom of Denmark but has broad autonomy.

Title: Ericsson wins Greenland 5G deal By Reuters
Description:
OSLO (Reuters) - Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson (BS:ERICAs) has 
been contracted to build a 5G network in Greenland, initially covering 
three towns...
paragraph:
FILE PHOTO: Ericsson logo is seen at its headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden June 14, 2018.
REUTERS/Olof Swahnberg//File PhotoNTGR -2.10% Add to/Remove from Watchlist ERICAs -19.61% Add to/Remove from WatchlistOSLO (Reuters) - Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson (BS: ) has been contracted to build a 5G network in Greenland, initially covering three towns, local phone company Tusass said on Friday.
Deploying Ericsson equipment and Netgear (NASDAQ: ) routers, Tusass will bring high-speed wireless internet to the sparsely populated island without resorting to expensive and hard-to-deploy cables, the company said.
Tusass said it plans to invest around 1 billion Danish crowns ($131.3 million) to secure and expand Greenland's infrastructure and improve communication.
($1 = 7.6155 Danish crowns)
